term.title: temperature-programmed chromatography

item.text: A procedure in which the temperature of the column is changed systematically during a part or the whole of the separation.

term.citation: Citation: 'temperature-programmed chromatography' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.T06267

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
